activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#398
activity.text:
@rithviknishad the new commit should have fixed the issue. I have tested by deploying in vercel. 
![Screenshot (49)](https://github.com/coronasafe/leaderboard/assets/97937213/576de474-d7dd-4cb0-baa3-fbb41ac0b807)

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#398
activity.text: @rithviknishad did it deploy successfully? Are any changes required?

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#398
activity.text: @rithviknishad yes the nextjs image component does support blur itself but only for images inside the public folder(static images). For dynamic images, such as the github profile pictures, the documentation recommends using plaiceholder to generate the base64url for the blurDataUrl. If i am wrong, please let me know. As for the error, I am currently searching for a solution. Some github issues recommend redeploying without cache to remove the old sharp modules. This error did not exists while running a production build in my local machine.

activity.title: coronasafe/leaderboard#308
activity.text:
@rithviknishad please review this PR.
Regarding GSOC, I know it's a bit early but I have a favor to ask. Could you check out my project proposal? Just a few minutes will be fine. I heard it was a common practice to get proposals checked by mentors a few weeks before application period begins. I am sorry if its not the case. If its ok by you, I will dm my google docs link to you in slack. Also in how many projects can each contributor apply? I didn't find any information related to it. I just know each contributor can apply to at most 3 organizations.

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#6715
activity.text:
Hi!
I am Hridaya. Getting straight to the point, I would like to contribute to this open source project by solving this issue for GSOC 2024. I am fairly experienced in Next.js and have more than 1.5 years+ experience working with Next.js and more than 2 years as a web developer. I wouldn't say I am a expert however I am more than an intermediate developer regarding Next.js  and the features such as SSR, SSG, ISR, streaming components as well as optimizing the performance of the website to have at least 90 score on lighthouse which is tough to obtain since Next.js is very heavy on performance in comparison to frameworks like Solid and Astro. So I hope I could get a chance to work on this open source project which aims to contribute towards the health sector.
